snippet: The problems Boeing is having with lithium-ion battery technology has led Airbus to change its plan, and use a conventional battery, made of nickel-cadmium.
abstract: Airbus, faced with potential of lengthy investigation into what caused batteries on two Boeing 787 planes to ignite or emit smoke, has dropped plans to use lithium-ion battery technology on its forthcoming wide-body A350 jet; will use conventional battery made of nickel-cadmium instead.

byline.original: By CHRISTOPHER DREW and NICOLA CLARK

lead_paragraph: The problems Boeing is having with lithium-ion battery technology has led Airbus to change its plan, and use a conventional battery, made of nickel-cadmium.

headline.seo: Airbus and Boeing on Different Paths on Battery
headline.main: To Avoid Delay, Airbus Drops Lithium-Ion Batteries
headline.print_headline: To Avoid Delay, Airbus Drops Lithium-Ion Batteries
